vistra.app.control.state

Class ParameterStateHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • vistra.app.control.state.ParameterStateHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.util.EventListener, IControlContext, IParameterStateHandler

    public final class ParameterStateHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements IParameterStateHandler
    A parameter handler: handles a graph and an algorithm as parameter for generating a traversal-object.

    As part of the graphic user interface control, this state handler is an action listener (graph I/O and item value editing), a graph-event listener (adding/deletion of graph item) and an item listener (algorithm selection), too.

    Author:
    Roland Bruggmann (brugr9@bfh.ch)
    See Also:
    StepByStep, Animation

      • openGraph

        int openGraph()
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Doing: Lets the user select a graph file by file-chooser and opens the graph.
        Returns:
        the return state of the file chooser on popdown:
        • JFileChooser.CANCEL_OPTION = 1
        • JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION = 0
        • JFileChooser.ERROR_OPTION = -1 if an error occurs or the dialog is dismissed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • newFileChooser

        private javax.swing.JFileChooser newFileChooser()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        A helper method: creates a file chooser.
        • files only
        • accept all file filter used: false
        • multi selection: false
        • choosable file filter removed
          Returns:
          the file chooser
          Throws:
          java.lang.Exception

        • confirmSavingGraph

          private int confirmSavingGraph()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
          A helper method: Brings up a dialog asking for saving the graph with the options Yes, No and Cancel. If the option Yes is chosen, saving the graph will be delegated depending on the actual state set.
          Returns:
          an integer indicating the option selected by the user:
          • JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION = 0
          • JOptionPane.YES_NO_CANCEL_OPTION = 1
          • JOptionPane.OK_CANCEL_OPTION = 2
          Throws:
          java.lang.Exception

        • setMode

          private void setMode(Mode mode)
          A helper method: Sets the mouse mode.
          Parameters:
          mode - the mode to set
          See Also:
